Question: However, this year this person was beaten for the NBA MVP Award by Karl Malone.
Hints: On October 6, 1993, this person announced his retirement, citing a loss of desire to play the game.
Playing limited minutes due to the frequent blowouts, this person averaged 14.9 ppg, finishing second on the team in scoring.
That year, this person was the only Washington player to play in all 82 games, starting in 67 of them.
